notes: Regulations are subject to change. Always verify with official state agencies before fishing.
Many waters have special regulations that supersede statewide limits.
Emergency orders may supersede published regulations.
Season dates and bag limits can vary significantly by specific water body.
Some states require additional permits for salmon and steelhead fishing.

license_requirements.notes: All anglers need to purchase an Angler Aquatic Invasive Species Prevention Pass (AISPP). Youth under 11 fish free but must observe all limits and regulations. Montana is divided into three fishing districts (Western, Central, Eastern) with varying regulations.

species.minimum_size_notes: Varies by water body; some waters have size restrictions
species.bag_limit_notes: Combined trout limit in streams: 3 daily, only one over 18 inches. Lakes: 5 daily, 10 in possession. Western and Central districts limited to 3 trout on streams.
species.season_closed: Specific waters may have seasonal closures
species.special_regulations: Some waters like Beaverhead River have catch-and-release only regulations for rainbow trout. Check specific water regulations.
species.geographic_restrictions: Regulations vary by fishing district and specific water body

species.minimum_size_notes: Varies by water body
species.bag_limit_notes: Combined trout limit in streams: 3 daily, only one over 18 inches. Lakes: 5 daily, 10 in possession.
species.season_closed: Specific waters may have seasonal closures
species.special_regulations: Part of combined trout limit. Individual waters may have additional restrictions.

species.minimum_size_notes: Varies by water body
species.bag_limit_notes: Combined trout limit in streams: 3 daily, only one over 18 inches. Lakes: 5 daily, 10 in possession.

species.bag_limit_notes: Combined trout limit in streams: 3 daily, only one over 18 inches. Lakes: 5 daily, 10 in possession.

species.bag_limit_notes: Lakes: 5 daily, 10 in possession (combined trout)

species.bag_limit_notes: Combined trout and kokanee salmon: 5 in combination

species.minimum_size_notes: Only 1 over 15 inches allowed
species.bag_limit_notes: 10 daily, only 1 over 15 inches. Possession limit is twice the daily limit.
species.special_regulations: Size restriction: only one fish over 15 inches per day

species.minimum_size_notes: 22 inches during June 15 - July 15
species.bag_limit_notes: 5 in possession except June 15 - July 15: only 1 allowed daily and in possession with 22 inch minimum
species.special_regulations: Special restrictions during spawning season (June 15 - July 15): 1 fish daily, 22 inch minimum

species.minimum_size_notes: 22 inches during June 15 - July 15
species.bag_limit_notes: 5 in possession except June 15 - July 15: only 1 allowed daily and in possession with 22 inch minimum
species.special_regulations: Special restrictions during spawning season (June 15 - July 15): 1 fish daily, 22 inch minimum

license_requirements.notes: Resident youth under 14 do not need a license. Nonresident youth under 14 do not need a license if accompanied by an adult with valid Wyoming license. Free Fishing Day on June 6, 2026.

species.minimum_size_notes: No more than 1 over 18 inches in some areas
species.bag_limit_notes: Total combined creel and possession limit for trout: 6 per day. Snake River below Jackson Lake Dam increased from 3 to 6 in 2026.
species.season_closed: Specific waters may have seasonal closures
species.special_regulations: Snake River: limit increased to 6 in 2026. North Platte River high-traffic areas require single-point, barbless hooks.
species.geographic_restrictions: Regulations vary by specific water body

species.minimum_size_notes: Snake River: length restrictions removed for brown trout in 2026
species.bag_limit_notes: Combined trout limit: 6 per day or in possession
species.season_closed: Specific waters may have seasonal closures
species.special_regulations: Snake River: length restrictions removed in 2026. Part of combined trout limit.

species.minimum_size_notes: Only one can exceed 12 inches
species.bag_limit_notes: 3 per day, only one over 12 inches. Separate limit from other trout species in some waters.
species.season_closed: Specific waters may have seasonal closures
species.special_regulations: Native species with specific protections. Snake River: limit unchanged at 3, only one over 12 inches.
species.geographic_restrictions: Statewide, particularly abundant in mountain waters

species.bag_limit_notes: Combined trout limit: 6 per day or in possession
species.season_closed: Specific waters may have seasonal closures

species.bag_limit_notes: Combined trout limit: 6 per day or in possession
species.special_regulations: Jackson Lake no longer closed in October; open year-round starting 2026

species.minimum_size_notes: Proposed changes: additional fish beyond 6 must be under 14 inches
species.bag_limit_notes: 12 per day or in possession in specific waters. General statewide: 6 of any size. Designated as nongame fish - all caught shall be killed immediately in some waters.
species.special_regulations: Designated as nongame fish in some waters; all caught must be killed immediately. Proposed regulation changes may allow increased limits for fish under 14 inches.
species.geographic_restrictions: Primarily in reservoirs and larger rivers

species.bag_limit_notes: 6 daily creel limit
species.special_regulations: Combined with smallmouth bass in creel limit

license_requirements.notes: Youth under 16 fish free with full bag limits. Youth 16-17 can purchase youth license for $10.23. Habitat Stamp required for ages 18-64 with first fishing license of season.

species.minimum_size_notes: No statewide size restriction; some waters have specific restrictions
species.bag_limit_notes: 4 per day, 8 in possession (statewide). Some waters more restrictive: 2 fish daily and in possession.
species.season_closed: Some waters may have seasonal closures
species.special_regulations: Many waters have special regulations. Check Special Regulations: Fishing Waters for specific locations.

species.minimum_size_notes: 15 inches in many areas; no size restriction in some designated waters
species.bag_limit_notes: No bag or possession limit in certain designated waters. Other waters may have specific limits.
species.special_regulations: Regulations vary widely by water body. Some waters have 15-inch minimum, others no restrictions.

license_requirements.notes: Children under 12 fish free. Nonresident fees increased significantly July 1, 2025. Multiple license options available: 3-day, 7-day, 365-day, and multi-year.

species.bag_limit_notes: 4-trout daily limit includes any combination of rainbow, brown, brook, cutthroat, splake, tiger trout, and lake trout
species.special_regulations: Part of combined trout, kokanee salmon, and Arctic grayling limit

species.bag_limit_notes: 4 fish at most waters; 3 fish at Flaming Gorge Reservoir. Combined with trout and Arctic grayling in daily limit. Cannot possess Sept 10 - Nov 30 statewide.
species.special_regulations: Anglers may not possess kokanee salmon at any waterbody statewide from Sept 10 through Nov 30. Flaming Gorge has 3-fish limit vs 4-fish elsewhere.

species.minimum_size_notes: Only 1 fish over 24 inches allowed
species.bag_limit_notes: 10 fish, with only 1 allowed over 24 inches
species.special_regulations: Size restriction: only one fish over 24 inches per day

species.minimum_size_notes: Catch-and-release only at some waters like Stansbury Lake
species.bag_limit_notes: No statewide bag limit specified. Some waters have specific restrictions (e.g., Stansbury Lake: catch-and-release only).
species.special_regulations: Regulations vary significantly by water body. Some waters are catch-and-release only.

species.bag_limit_notes: No statewide bag limit specified. Check specific water body regulations.

license_requirements.notes: Resident kids under 14 fish free with own bag limit. Nonresident kids under 14 must be with licensed adult and fish count toward adult's limit. Additional Salmon/Steelhead Permit required for anadromous species. Price Lock program available for residents.

species.bag_limit_notes: 6 fish (includes Brown, Golden, Lake, Cutthroat, Rainbow, and hybrids combined)
species.season_closed: Many rivers and streams have special seasons
species.special_regulations: No person may have in field or transport any trout from which head or tail has been removed unless specific conditions met

species.special_regulations: Only barbless hooks may be used when fishing for steelhead in Salmon and Clearwater river drainages and Snake River below Hells Canyon Dam. Salmon/Steelhead Permit required.

species.minimum_size_notes: None under 12 inches
species.bag_limit_notes: 6 bass (Largemouth and Smallmouth combined), none under 12 inches
species.special_regulations: 12-inch minimum size. No person may have in field or transport bass from which head or tail removed unless specific conditions met.

species.minimum_size_notes: None under 12 inches
species.bag_limit_notes: 6 bass (combined with largemouth), none under 12 inches
species.special_regulations: 12-inch minimum size. Combined bag limit with largemouth bass.

license_requirements.nonresident_cost_annual: Varies: $30 for Interstate Boundary Waters license, higher for statewide
license_requirements.notes: Nonresident anglers under 12 do not need license but fish taken must not exceed 50% of limit. Licenses valid one year from purchase date. Resident must have lived in Nevada 6 months and not claimed residency elsewhere.

species.bag_limit_notes: 5 trout daily limit in Western Region. Possession limit is two times the daily limit.
species.special_regulations: Regulations vary by region and specific water body
species.geographic_restrictions: Statewide; Western Region includes Carson City, Churchill, Douglas, Lyon, Humboldt, Mineral, Pershing, Storey, Washoe counties

species.bag_limit_notes: 5 trout daily limit (combined species)
species.special_regulations: Part of combined trout limit

species.bag_limit_notes: 5 trout daily limit (combined species)
species.special_regulations: Native species. Part of combined trout limit. Some waters may have additional protections.

species.special_regulations: Part of combined trout limit

species.bag_limit_notes: 5 trout daily limit (combined species)
species.special_regulations: Part of combined trout limit. Primarily in Lake Tahoe and Pyramid Lake.

species.minimum_size_notes: Minimum size limit in some waters - 3 daily
species.bag_limit_notes: Western Region: 15 warmwater game fish daily, of which not more than 5 may be walleye. Other regions may vary.
species.special_regulations: Part of warmwater game fish aggregate limit in Western Region

species.bag_limit_notes: Western Region: 15 warmwater game fish daily, of which not more than 5 may be black bass. Other areas: 5 to 10 black bass depending on location.

species.bag_limit_notes: Western Region: 15 warmwater game fish, not more than 5 black bass. Combined with largemouth bass.
species.special_regulations: Part of black bass aggregate limit

important_warnings: ALWAYS verify current regulations before fishing - these are reference only
Many waters have special regulations that override statewide limits
Emergency orders can change regulations at any time
Check for water-specific closures and restrictions
Some states require special permits for salmon and steelhead
Interstate boundary waters may have different regulations
Always check current season dates - some announced annually
Barbless hook requirements vary by species and location
regional_considerations: Mountain West states have significant elevation variations affecting species distribution
Native cutthroat trout populations are protected in many waters
Anadromous fish (salmon, steelhead) limited to specific drainages in Idaho
Water-specific regulations are common due to varying habitat conditions
Ice fishing regulations may differ from open water fishing
Tribal waters may have separate regulations
Federal lands (National Parks, Forests) may have additional restrictions

species_notes.trout: Combined trout limits are common. Size restrictions often focus on protecting trophy fish. Some waters are catch-and-release only.
species_notes.bass: Bass regulations generally less restrictive than trout. Spawning season protections in Montana. Minimum size limits common in Colorado and Idaho.
species_notes.walleye: Slot limits and maximum size restrictions used to protect spawning populations. Some states designate as nongame fish in certain waters.
species_notes.salmon: Kokanee salmon (landlocked sockeye) have combined limits with trout. Anadromous salmon require special permits and have very limited seasons.
species_notes.steelhead: Considered anadromous rainbow trout. Idaho requires special permit. Barbless hooks required in many areas.

license_summary.age_requirements: Most states require licenses at age 12-14 and older. Youth under minimum age typically fish free.
license_summary.resident_qualifications: Generally 6-12 months residency required. Cannot claim residency in another state.
license_summary.daily_options: All states offer daily/short-term licenses for visitors
license_summary.senior_discounts: Most states offer reduced rates for seniors (typically 65+)
license_summary.special_permits: Idaho requires separate Salmon/Steelhead permit for anadromous species
license_summary.habitat_stamps: Colorado requires separate Habitat Stamp for ages 18-64

data_gaps: Federal land special regulations not fully covered
Ice fishing specific regulations not detailed
Tournament and special event regulations not included
Specific boundary water agreements not fully documented
recommendations: Purchase official state regulation booklets for complete information
Download state fishing apps for GPS-based regulation lookup
Check for emergency orders before each fishing trip
Learn proper fish identification to avoid violations
Keep regulations booklet or phone app while fishing
Report violations to state wildlife agencies
Consider hiring local guides for complex waters
